result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clinton Vernon Gleason

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearinfg proceeded on the Record.  Defense requested to WAIVE Defendant's appearance.  COURT WAIVED DEFENDANT'S APPEARANCE FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS HEARING.  Court noted that Defendant is seriously ill.  On Motion of the State,  Court ordered case DISMISSED with Prejudice.  Court ordered Restitution payable to STEVEN B. in the amount of SIX HUNDRED FORTY-SEVEN DOLLARS AND EIGHTEEN CENTS ($647.18) to be converted FORTHWITH to a Civil Judgment.
Filed, sdg.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is terminally ill.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BECH WARRANT UNTI LTHE NEXT DATE.  COURT MAY WAIVE DEFENDANT'S APPEARANCE AT THE NEXT DATE.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for final Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that Defendant is testing negative.  State advised that Defendant owes in excess of SIX HUNDRED DOLLARS ($600.00) in Restitution and that they will need to contact the Victim before the matter can be resolved.  Defense advised that the Defendant will be returning to treatment beginning 05-23-2016.  Defense requested that the Defendant's appearance be WAIVED at the next hearing.  State requested an adjournment.  Court GRANTED Defense's request to WAIVE the Defendant's appearance at the next hearing.  Court went off the Record to hold sidebar with all Counsel.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is in the ICU.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTILTHE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Fokus Family Service progress report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail previously set in the amount of $1000.00, but not posted at this time.  If posted, to be returned (refunded) to the remitter.
Bail motion by State granted by the Court.

Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court in trial.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason not in court, in custody.  
Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Defense bail motion heard, objected to by the state, and DENIED by the Court.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter before Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests bail/bond hearing.   Case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 26.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
FILE RETAINED IN COURT UNTIL NEXT HEARING.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court appearing by telephone, defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel newly appointed, requests scheduling conference.    Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From defendant filed.

Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason not in court, defendant in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No attorney appearance.  Defense counsel assigned to this case is leaving the public defender's office.  The Court made contact with the public defender's office and scheduled this case for status of counsel to ensure representation for next hearing.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel received discovery and requests Projected guilty plea/sentencing date.  Case adjourned for Projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Scheduling conference.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in custody.  James Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Steve B. or the apartment complex listed on the complaint

Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Clinton Vernon Gleason in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
